Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Pilosulin 1 (Myr b I) (natural AMPs; antss, insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Structure:  Random coil in water but helical in the presence of 50% TFE. The N-terminal 20 residues are likely to be the dominating antimicrobial region (Zelezetsky I et al. 2005 Arch Bichem Biophys. 434: 358-364). Its structure has been determined by NMR.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structure of N-terminal peptide P1herein the PDB.Activity:Toxicity: it completely disrupted RBC at 40 uM after 24 h incubation, stronger than melittin. Activity is lost in serum.
Literature Information.Author: Donovan GR, Baldo BA, Sutherland S1993
Literature Information.Title: Molecular cloning and characterization of a major allergen (Myr p I) from the venom of the Australian jumper ant, Myrmecia pilosula.
